title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.40 | 26-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Yudhishtira at once relinquished all his garments, belt and ornaments of the royal order and became completely disinterested and unattached to everything
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam describing Maharaj Yudhishtira's detachment from household affairs.

segments.key_quote: To become purified of material contamination is the necessary qualification becoming one of the associates of the Lord
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is discussed, emphasizing the need for purification from material contamination to return to Godhead.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Yudhishthirath therefore to become spiritually pure spiritually pure means free from all material contamination
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on renunciation, referencing the saffron loincloth of a sannyasi and Maharaj Yudhishtira's giving up of royal garments.

segments.key_quote: Bhakti means sarva upadhi vinir muktam upadhi means designation to become free from all designations is the way to actually practice bhakti
segments.summary: The discussion shifts to becoming free from material designations as a key aspect of practicing bhakti.

segments.key_quote: All these are designations which are the cause for our attachment and bondage in this material world
segments.summary: Various types of material designations, such as family, society, wealth, and titles, are identified as causes of attachment and bondage.

segments.key_quote: Naham vipro na cha narapati na pi vaisho na shudro naham varni na cha grahapati no vanastho yatirva
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's teachings on renouncing even the designations within the heart and identifying oneself as a servant of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Everyone, every living being, we are eternally Krishna's servants or Krishna's devotees.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by emphasizing that being a devotee of Krishna is our eternal position, and the role of a sannyasi is to disseminate spiritual knowledge without expecting anything in return, maintaining humility.
